intro: Dasystachys campanulata, commonly known as the bell-shaped false heather, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively uncommon in horticultural trade.
